Run Flink ValidatesRunner

I think this can work for now. üëç I'm not completely happy because the IDs are contingent on the order of creation of the outputs. (This is the same for the Dataflow Runner, I think, but we should still keep it in mind.)

@bjchambers, I only rebased on master and cleaned unneeded comments. PTAL at my responses to your comments.
Thanks.

Coverage increased (+0.007%) to 69.978% when pulling **a147b24c3392b1c7755cebd2d3980bd12497c460 on mariapython:retry** into **d035a345fe4f281761c03dda2cec39e648149a68 on apache:master**.
BeamSqlEnv can be removed if we only consider BeamSql, but it is needed very soon for the BeamSqlCli(I already have a pending PR: #3481 ), I'd prefer to make it ready for the comming BeamSqlCli PR.
close #3716, thank you @takidau

I guess `BeamSqlEnv` can be hidden(I suppose any class in package `*.impl` is treated as hidden) for both `BeamSql` and `BeamSqlCli`. 
Each `BeamSqlCli` will have a shared `BeamSqlEnv`, and `public void execute(String sqlString)` would be the only exposed method, --TBD in future regarding to details of `BeamSqlCli`.
Retest this please

Changes Unknown when pulling **b0b64218257576ef20601fd31e075e4a8e297a60 on master** into ** on DSL_SQL**.

Rebased.

Summary:

* Only keep one `BeamSqlEnv` in `impl` package.
* Re-organized the surfacing apis to only remain: 
  * BeamSql
  * BeamSqlUdf
  * BeamRecordSqlType
  * BeamSqlRecordHelper 
* Refactored `QueryTransform` and `SimpleQueryTransform` to enable more code reuse.

I think there may be a lot of Runners need to care about this matter, maybe Beam can optimize the Runner API here.
